citation.title: Disturbed mitochondrial and peroxisomal dynamics due to loss of MFF causes Leigh-like encephalopathy, optic atrophy and peripheral neuropathy.

citation.name: Science
citation.title: The consensus coding sequences of human breast and colorectal cancers.

comment.text: Plays a role in mitochondrial and peroxisomal fission. Promotes the recruitment and association of the fission mediator dynamin-related protein 1 (DNM1L) to the mitochondrial surface. May be involved in regulation of synaptic vesicle membrane dynamics by recruitment of DNM1L to clathrin-containing vesicles.
Homodimer. Interacts with DNM1L. Interacts with C11orf65/MFI; the interaction inhibits MFF interaction with DNM1L.
Highly expressed in heart, kidney, liver, brain, muscle, and stomach.

disease.name: Encephalopathy due to defective mitochondrial and peroxisomal fission 2
disease.description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by delayed psychomotor development, severe hypotonia with inability to walk, microcephaly, and abnormal signals in the basal ganglia. More variable features include early-onset seizures, optic atrophy, and peripheral neuropathy.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: MFF-related encephalopathy due to mitochondrial and peroxisomal fission defect
Expressed in sperm and 239 other tissues
C:integral component of mitochondrial outer membrane
P:mitochondrial fragmentation involved in apoptotic process
P:positive regulation of protein targeting to membrane
P:positive regulation of release of cytochrome c from mitochondria
P:release of cytochrome c from mitochondria

feature.description: Helical; Anchor for type IV membrane protein
In isoform 2, isoform 3, isoform 4 and isoform 5.
In a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation.
